column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St opens higher as tech stocks gain
column5: Jan 17 Wall Street's main indexes opened higher on Wednesday  led by gains in technology stocks including Microsoft and IBM.

column4: U.S. lawmaker asks Intel  others for briefing on chip flaws
column5: WASHINGTON A Democratic U.S. lawmaker asked Intel Corp and two other microchip makers on Tuesday to provide a briefing on the recently detected Spectre and Meltdown security flaws that could allow hackers to steal information from most computers and devices.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. lawmaker asks Intel  others for briefing on chip flaws
column5: WASHINGTON  Jan 16 A Democratic U.S. lawmaker asked Intel Corp and two other microchip makers on Tuesday to provide a briefing on the recently detected Spectre and Meltdown security flaws that could allow hackers to steal information from most computers and devices.

column4: Oracle issues security patches for chip flaws
column5: Oracle Corp said on Tuesday it issued a critical patch that provides fixes for certain of its products for Intel Corp chip flaws.

column4: Oracle issues security patches for chip flaws
column5: Jan 16 Oracle Corp said on Tuesday it issued a critical patch that provides fixes for certain of its products for Intel Corp chip flaws.

column4: UPDATE 3-FTC investigating Broadcom for antitrust practices
column5: Jan 17 The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is investigating whether chipmaker Broadcom Ltd engaged in anticompetitive tactics in negotiations with customers  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: BRIEF-Broadcom Says FTC Review Immaterial To Business  No Impact On Qualcomm Proposal
column5: * BROADCOM LTD SAYS "FTC REVIEW IS IMMATERIAL TO OUR BUSINESS  DOES NOT RELATE TO WIRELESS AND HAS NO IMPACT ON OUR PROPOSAL TO ACQUIRE QUALCOMM" Further company coverage:
